title: ICE: min_specialization: `failed while formatting fluent string `hir_analysis_impl_not_marked_default_err`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-translation
labels.description: Area: Translation infrastructure, and migrating existing diagnostics to SessionDiagnostic

body:
### Code ```Rust #![feature(min_specialization)] struct S; impl From for S { fn from(s: S) -> S { s } } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.71.0-nightly (473f916d8 2023-05-03) binary: rustc commit-hash: 473f916d836cc662c5bdbb0d40af9fb4678fab9e commit-date: 2023-05-03 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.71.0-nightly LLVM version: 16.0.2 ``` ### Error output ``` ```
Backtrace

``` error[E0601]: `main` function not found in crate `treereduce` --> treereduce.out:12:10 | 12 | struct X; | ^ consider adding a `main` function to `treereduce.out` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: failed while formatting fluent string `hir_analysis_impl_not_marked_default_err`: the attribute `label` was missing help: add `.label = ` ', compiler/rustc_errors/src/emitter.rs:2399:77 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7fb99b969441 - For more information about an error, try `rustc --explain E0520`. ```
